channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge orders an end to Trump's troop deployment in D.C., calling it 'unlawful'
item.description: U.S. District Judge Jia Cobb put a pause on her order until Dec. 11 to allow the Trump administration time to appeal.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. District Judge Jia Cobb put a pause on her order until Dec. 11 to allow the Trump administration time to appeal.

(Image credit: Al Drago)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: A Venezuelan stargazer is sharing his passion while trying to stay in the U.S.
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have lost their legal right to stay in the U.S., among them an amateur astronomer sharing his love of stargazing as he tries to secure a visa.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of thousands of Venezuelans have lost their legal right to stay in the U.S., among them an amateur astronomer sharing his love of stargazing as he tries to secure a visa.
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: Alaska wants financially strained districts to take ownership of rural schools
item.description: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.content:encoded: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling rural schools. But now it wants cash-strapped districts to take on ownership of those buildings in exchange for funding to fix them.
item.dc:creator: Emily Schwing

item.title: As immigration crackdowns move on, Chicago group aims to share resistance techniques
item.description: A neighborhood network in Chicago is now helping other cities that face immigration crackdowns. The group recently put years of resistance training to the test, as federal agents focused on Chicago.
item.content:encoded: A neighborhood network in Chicago is now helping other cities that face immigration crackdowns. The group recently put years of resistance training to the test, as federal agents focused on Chicago.
item.dc:creator: Odette Yousef

item.title: Recalled baby formula linked to a botulism outbreak may still be in some stores
item.description: A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.
item.content:encoded:
A botulism outbreak that has sickened more than two dozen babies in 15 states has been linked to ByHeart formula sold nationwide. Here's what to know about it.

(Image credit: Cheyanne Mumphrey)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: White House condemns Democratic lawmakers' video but backs off Trump's posts
item.description: The Democratic lawmakers said that members of the military can and must refuse illegal orders by their superiors.
item.content:encoded:
The Democratic lawmakers said that members of the military can and must refuse illegal orders by their superiors.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Saige Miller

item.title: The latest Epstein emails reveal the powerful people who sought his counsel
item.description: The latest emails from Jeffrey Epstein's estate show communications with a vast web of influential figures in politics, academia, business and more, even after he registered as a sex offender.
item.content:encoded:
The latest emails from Jeffrey Epstein's estate show communications with a vast web of influential figures in politics, academia, business and more, even after he registered as a sex offender.

(Image credit: Mehmet Eser)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: She cares for her aging parents full time. That requires taking care of herself, too
item.description: Dawnita Brown left her job to become a caregiver for her parents. Brown says it's a gift to care for her parents, but it can also be difficult. That's why respite is an important part of her life.
item.content:encoded:
Dawnita Brown left her job to become a caregiver for her parents. Brown says it's a gift to care for her parents, but it can also be difficult. That's why respite is an important part of her life.

(Image credit: Claire Harbage)
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The Justice Department's case against James Comey hits a new hurdle, the latest Epstein emails reveal the powerful people who sought his counsel, tech giant Nvidia reports blockbuster earnings.
item.content:encoded: The Justice Department's case against James Comey hits a new hurdle, the latest Epstein emails reveal the powerful people who sought his counsel, tech giant Nvidia reports blockbuster earnings.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Food banks, already strained, brace for prolonged demand
item.description: Even as SNAP benefits are restored, food banks and pantries around the nation continue to feel the strain with no reprieve in sight.
item.content:encoded:
Even as SNAP benefits are restored, food banks and pantries around the nation continue to feel the strain with no reprieve in sight.

(Image credit: Tovia Smith)
item.dc:creator: Tovia Smith
